9E7580FC5C8F48BBBD066720E3B14470.description:
With prompting and support, speak
audibly in complete sentences
expressing thoughts, feelings, and
ideas appropriately. (See Kindergarten Language standard 1
for specific expectations.)

A51D18CE9875471C8B6F2FDC6F76CC50.description:
When speaking, add visual displays
to provide additional detail.

85284B603B39404BB33DC690AD578FB6.description:
Describe familiar people, places,
things, and events and, with
prompting and support, provide
additional detail.

52D4ABF54D68422D8FDD6AD34483A233.description:
Ask and answer questions about
what a speaker says in order to
seek help, get information or clarify
something that is not understood.

5D0A2C2B7D414F4EB4D143B2F775DD65.description:
With guidance and support,confirm
understanding from a read aloud or
media presentation by summarizing
main facts, answering questions or
asking for needed clarification.

A201EA8FE3644F11810E0CA5AF1D89C8.description:
With guidance and support,
students will ask questions to clear
up any confusion about the topics
and texts under discussion.

722853D630B744D3AC99F7980017BF63.description:
Continue a conversation by adding
own words and thoughts.

8D4055D9935A42C68F4DF28899C8CF72.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for
discussions (e.g., listening to
others and taking turns speaking
about the topics and texts under
discussion).

5B5E693AD1054CD5B37386BCC51E95BA.description:
Participate in conversations with
peers and adults in large and small
groups.

F16A8EE9352F4CA99E44E24A8538D3EA.description:
Use words and phrases acquired
through conversations, reading and
being read to, and responding to
texts.

575376F4EA804629BA21212B7802B8A0.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning
among verbs describing the same
general action (e.g., walk, march,
strut, prance) by acting out the
meanings.

5A363AC73D164FDA9692F993922CBD88.description:
Identify real-life connections
between words and their use (e.g.,
note places at school that are
colorful).

ED5DCA2AB45546A49D661054C58E7F4B.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
frequently occurring verbs and
adjectives by relating them to their
opposites (antonyms).

09F36A313BD64811B5FDFFC2F7565A89.description:
Sort common objects into
categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to
gain a sense of the concepts the
categories represent.

3570214A779E4D2695DAC664E294D8BE.description:
With guidance and support from
adults, explore word relationships
and nuances in word meanings.

0DF02CBD32344EC182A9153E94D17A6C.description:
With support, understand the most
frequently occurring inflections and
affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-,
pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the

20

meaning of an unknown word.

778913E9D9BF4BB6A247669BC550A540.description:
Identify new meanings for familiar
words and apply them accurately
(e.g., knowing duck is a bird and
learning the verb to duck).

16978AA764BD4E8B91BCA9B9433FB8BB.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of
unknown and multiple-meaning
words and phrases based on
kindergarten reading and content.

F2F4C85FCCC644578471CA7E754CEEF1.description:
Write a letter or letters for most
consonant and short-vowel sounds

19

(phonemes).

576B24CD410342629680B4C0C46461B4.description:
Recognize, name, and use
appropriate end punctuation.

02D20308AA25421B8D007B6D39A226E9.description:
Capitalize the first word in a
sentence and the pronoun I.

0AB8466D2EDF47F98C20AEAC38E9AF70.description:
Demonstrate command of the
conventions of standard English
capitalization, punctuation, and
spelling when writing.

0F4B48A0A7C2486580365A4F22325BB0.description:
Produce and expand complete
sentences in shared language
activities.

B6E05BA3F5A54DCB8D7B1AF61DADA5CA.description:
Use the most frequently occurring
prepositions and pronouns (e.g.,
to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of,
by, with, she, he).

85554719886E4FA5A447F1804B231D7B.description:
Understand and use question words
(interrogatives) (e.g., who, what,
where, when, why, how).

7DD1327B83F1453690BACC388ABC7D2B.description:
Use frequently occurring nouns and
verbs.

CE4046A8295B497C93DBC7BEB41B9DAC.description:
Print many upper- and lowercase
letters using correct formation.

99F433AF748F4E43B0D858B347A6706E.description:
Demonstrate command of the
conventions of standard English
grammar and usage when writing or
speaking.

28658F0DB4274A61A5F16B9BF5CF5738.description:
Write routinely over extended time
frames to build stamina.

416C0E6A2AE1400A855230E842AE94F0.description:
With guidance and support from
adults, recall information from
experiences or gather information
from provided sources to answer a
question.

BF57FD3D742043CA8EF7AC045B30F48C.description:
Participate in shared research and
writing projects.

B1E5870C64ED416E81EE01367EF689EC.description: CLUSTER 3: PRODUCTION AND DISTRIBUTION OF WRITING

FB5E1250C03A4C3B9DAE2517316675A5.description:
With guidance and support from
adults, explore a variety of digital
tools to produce and publish
writing, including in collaboration
with peers.

AAB5296E7940467B901A1A96309EF251.description:
With guidance and support from
adults, respond to questions and
suggestions from peers and add
details to strengthen writing as
needed.

6F5CE58B10694CDABCEB82F635EE2E7D.description: CLUSTER 2: PRODUCTION AND DISTRIBUTION OF WRITING

0F2F69CCF3364BF89DBE2786E8934623.description:
With prompting and support, use a
combination of drawing, dictating,
and writing to narrate a single
event or several loosely linked
events, and tell about the events
in the order in which they
occurred.

7AAEEB77BADF48059AF0C9CF6F18F450.description:
With prompting and support, use a
combination of drawing, dictating,
and writing to compose
informative/explanatory texts in
which they name what they are
writing about and supply some
information about the topic.

97F40742CFDE42CB9B425CED202DFFFB.description:
With prompting and support, use a
combination of drawing, dictating,
and writing to state an opinion or
preference about the topic or book
and supply a reason (e.g., My
favorite book is . . .because...).

61A7A276F7A64F36AF77F6708A693226.description:
Use letter-sound knowledge to
write simple messages and words,
which accurately represent
predominant sounds in sequence.

61C745D185644CC49BDD34A634F3707C.description:
With prompting and support
identify, name and produce the
sounds of common digraphs (e.g.,
th, wh, sh, ch).

6E95829F83E74E3AB51CA139BD35D2E2.description:
Distinguish between similarly
spelled words by identifying the
sounds of the letters that differ.

9A28FF039CC34434B52C51C2F70629DB.description:
Read common high-frequency
words by sight (e.g., the, of, to,
you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

B3EBC99F15154D7AAA16679986AAC350.description:
Associate the long and short
sounds with common spellings
(graphemes) for the five major
vowels.

0C53234A4F6340DFAAEFB916954BAC5C.description:
Produce and write a letter or
letters for most consonant sounds.

B627C11744C64D35A41D165757F88952.description:
Know and apply grade-level
phonics and word analysis skills in
decoding words.

D20D6E081CF44FDEB26CE9F718809CC7.description:
Add or substitute individual sounds
(phonemes) in simple, one-syllable
words to make new words.

D1561B7760014B4F94AC4E6DC59E6E41.description:
Isolate and pronounce the initial,
medial vowel, and final sounds
(phonemes) in CVC words.

CB0400EE8CA04C92A148EA23B97B0684.description:
Blend and segment onsets and
rimes of single-syllable spoken
words.

9FE360D0A0594DD08B37943EA17C96C9.description:
Count, pronounce, blend, and
segment syllables in spoken words.

217463B750434637938D05D232577327.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
spoken words, syllables, and
sounds (phonemes).

CED68D710816438C9ACFD1B3EA22D7B2.description:
Recognize and name all upper- and
lowercase letters of the alphabet.

50CB29FB7C1C417EBB67373CD5CCCFDA.description:
Understand that words are
separated by spaces in print.

9ADFE70BF4FB454C8C7F919CB93AE135.description:
Recognize that spoken words are
represented in written language by
specific sequences of letters.

3A4E2DE7B100426F8BC19042C7BC8B24.description:
Follow words from left to right, top
to bottom, and page by page.

44AB43F310844B6A80007F1D23B42FAE.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the
organization and basic features of
print.

571F2C46E95C4659BD55CD05894BFFB6.description:
Actively engage in group reading
activities with purpose and
understanding.

9A88887906424BD2A337CFBE18A40F5A.description:
With prompting and support
participate in group reading
activities with purpose and
understanding.

8F643F86AE8A480DA32A90F2074F85B8.description: CLUSTER 4: RANGE OF READING AND LEVEL OF TEXT COMPLEXITY

2E9B992E0EFA471981F38677A6DA3D0B.description:
With prompting and support,
identify basic similarities in and
differences between two texts on
the same topic (e.g., in
illustrations, descriptions, or
procedures).

63A41B08D8064601B265A82026192122.description:
With prompting and support,
compare and contrast the
adventures and experiences of
characters in familiar stories.

C86BB1DD5FEC4D5DBB423246AFB76DA2.description:
Identify the author’s purpose in a
nonfiction text.

6FE68C74CE734210B1545252F300C52F.description:
Use pictures and context to aid

8

comprehension and to draw
conclusions or make predictions
about story content.

0487266FAA0B48598510A6527585FDC5.description:
With prompting and support,
develop understanding of
relationships between illustrations
and texts (e.g., Why do you think
___? How can you tell ___? How do
you know ___?)

03D5C519F798416894601E507E43C6A3.description: CLUSTER 3: INTEGRATION AND KNOWLEDGE OF IDEAS

A048C8C86A3349B988BEFC9D5273CA71.description:
Name the author and illustrator
and/or photographer of a text and
define the role of each in
presenting the ideas or information
in a text.

1282793460E8498F9835F846C4C5256D.description:
With prompting and support, name
the author and illustrator of a story
and define the role of each in
telling the story.

1F5539A9CF424FFDAD2853FA102A3120.description:
Identify textual and graphic
features of a nonfiction text (e.g.,
title, author, table of contents,
illustrations, and index).

CFFEEE28C6374515B9816611C4EF4E60.description:
Recognize common types of texts
(e.g., storybooks, poems) and
distinguish fantasy from realism.

D71F5E443F624FEEA4ECB40B6F7D65AB.description:
With prompting use new words
acquired by listening to literary or
informational texts read aloud.

53E3A658ABCA4CFCAE10724D3D835DD0.description:
With prompting and support, ask
and answer questions about
unknown words in a text.

1510248820AB47BEB9E47BF5365E3AAF.description:
Predict the meaning of a new word
from its context when listening to a
text being read aloud.

5D8427BB4F464169A2BA1D91B1B040A5.description:
With prompting and support,

6

describe the connection between
two individuals, events, ideas, or
pieces of information in a text.

552A64B5D88145ECB5721E94F1978059.description:
With prompting and support,
identify the main topic and retell
key details of a text.

19D11E212F264FA2BFEA278389771CE8.description:
With prompting and support, retell
familiar stories, including key
details, (beginning, middle, end).

E8E9B74147DD43B997EAB15675873DA2.description:
With prompting and support, ask
and answer questions about key
details in a text.
